author: Post Features Staff
title: TO DO: Concert band performance, fall festival in Palm Beach... | www.palmbeachpost.com
text:
BOCA RATON
Eleanor Roosevelt
Florida Atlantic University will present “Eleanor Roosevelt and the Battle for Human Rights: 1945 to Present” on Wednesday at 4 p.m. in the University Theatre. The speaker is Allida Black. She served as founding editor of “The Eleanor Roosevelt Papers,” a project designed to preserve, teach and apply her writings and discussions of human rights and democratic politics. $20. 777 Glades Road. 800-564-9539; www.fauevents.com
PALM BEACH GARDENS
Got brass?
These folks do! The 80-piece Palm Beach Gardens Concert Band takes the stage at 7:30 on Wednesday at the Eissey Campus Theatre . The performance, “All That Brass,” will include “Tip-Toe Through the Tubas.” Conductor Randy Sonntag is preparing a variety show for all tastes. The program also includes selections from “The Sound of Music” and other Broadway show tunes, as well as Sousa marches. $15. 11051 Campus Drive (on the campus of Palm Beach State College). 561-207-5900; www.palmbeachstate.edu/theatre
Fall fest
The City of Palm Beach Gardens is hosting its Fall Festival on Friday from 6 to 8 p.m. at the Burns Road Recreation Center . This family event will feature trick-or-treating, children’s activities, live music by Burnt Biscuit, a candy-corn count, and food and drinks for purchase. Don’t forget your costume and trick-or-treat bag. Free. 4404 Burns Road. 561-630-1100; www.pbgfl.com
WEST PALM BEACH
Wild celebration
The Palm Beach Zoo is hosting Boo at the Zoo on Friday and Saturday from 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. Featuring costume contests, trick-or-treating, a pumpkin patch, wildlife shows, face painting and more, this event will keep your ghosts and ghoulies occupied. $19.50, adults; $17.50, 60-plus; $14.50, 3-12 years. 1301 Summit Blvd. 561-547-9453; www.palmbeachzoo.org
</span
